title: Supreme Court Rejects Bid by Illinois GOP to Avoid Limits on Gatherings
summary: State Republicans, seeking exemption from the 50-person cap ordered by the Democratic governor, cancel Independence Day picnic. WASHINGTON-The Supreme Court on Saturday rejected a bid by Illinois Republicans to lift Gov. J.B. Pritzker's public-health order limiting gatherings to 50 or fewer people, disrupting plans for an Independence Day picnic south of Chicago.

title: Celebrations Are Subdued as U.S. Virus Cases Surge
summary: Government leaders have urged people to use caution as they celebrate Independence Day. Americans celebrated a scaled-back Fourth of July, with many events canceled and officials urging people to take extra precautions as the U.S. recorded more than 50,000 new coronavirus cases for a third consecutive day.

title: Coronavirus, Justice Fights Shadow Fourth of July Events
summary: Some towns held drive-through parades and scaled-down fireworks displays. We are delighted that you'd like to resume your subscription.

title: U.K. Government, Bharti Global Commit $1 Billion to Buy Satellite Company OneWeb
summary: Deal will enable satellite company to restart operations. The U.K. government and Bharti Global Ltd. have committed to pay $1 billion to acquire satellite company OneWeb and fund the restart of its operations, the parties said Friday.

title: Cleveland Indians Will Consider a Name Change
summary: The baseball club has taken steps to distance themselves from certain elements of their identity, including removing their Chief Wahoo logo from their uniforms in 2019. Cleveland's Major League Baseball franchise, known as the Indians since 1915, said it would consider changing its nickname, a move that comes amid a recent movement across the U.S. to reexamine iconography that is thought to be racist or racially insensitive.

title: Time for RV Investors to Hit the Road
summary: Shares of RV companies have accelerated over the last three months, but could soon run out of gas. The recreational-vehicle industry is enjoying a nice ride, but investors shouldn't park their money for long.

title: How a Lincoln-Douglass Debate Led to Historic Discovery
summary: Texting exchange by two professors led to Frederick Douglass letter on Emancipation Memorial. WASHINGTON-It was a text-message debate that led Scott Sandage and Jonathan White to discover a vital American artifact last weekend: a long-forgotten letter showing how Frederick Douglass really felt about a statue of Abraham Lincoln and a slave.

title: India's Retaliation Against China Carries Economic Costs
summary: New Delhi has banned Chinese apps after 20 Indian soldiers were killed in a Himalayan border clash. NEW DELHI-India intends its ban on Chinese apps to show its willingness to dismantle important economic links between the two countries to pressure Beijing to back off in a border dispute, Indian officials and analysts say.

title: Tax Lawyer Reinvented Himself as a Crusading Professor
summary: After Wall Street career, Edward Kleinbard advocated higher government spending on education and infrastructure.

title: A North Korean Defector's Tale Shows Rotting Military
summary: Resume Subscription. SEOUL-They were supposed to represent North Korea's fighting elite. Dispatched to Korea's demilitarized zone roughly three years ago, Roh Chol Min was a new recruit on the front lines. He sized up his fellow 46 soldiers in the unit and saw men like himself: tall, young and connected.

title: NYC Restaurants Open Outposts in the Hamptons This Summer
summary: The coronavirus has pushed restaurateurs to creatively expand offerings amid pandemic-related restrictions and financial pressure. New Yorkers who make their way to Long Island's East End and other popular warm-weather retreats this summer may find they haven't left the city behind, at least in a culinary sense.

title: Home Caregivers Shoulder Burden in Covid-19 Fight
summary: While toiling for low wages, they can find themselves-and their elderly clients-at risk: 'This is extremely hard work'. LOS ANGELES-As Covid-19 infections surge, home caregivers including Lesia Louro are working on the hidden front line in the battle with the pandemic.

title: She Skates to Stay Fit as Coronavirus Rolls On
summary: Resume Subscription. Stacy Zaninovich never imagined the tiny kitchen of her Fullerton, Calif., apartment could double as a roller rink. But when California ordered residents to stay at home in March, she set a goal of roller skating every day of quarantine.

title: States With Earlier Success Now Battle Coronavirus Surge
summary: As places across the South register major outbreaks, states that enjoyed earlier success worry about maintaining their low count. While states across the South struggle with major outbreaks of the new coronavirus, others that stemmed its spread in recent weeks face the challenge of maintaining that success, as summer contributes to increased travel and social-distancing fatigue.

title: 'Live at Luthjen's' by Evan Christopher and David Torkanowsky Review: Legacy of a Dance Hall
summary: Recorded at a historic New Orleans venue, the clarinet-piano duo's album approaches the city's jazz traditions with equal parts reverence and invention..

title: The Staying Inside Guide: Raise a Glass to Art History
summary: The Frick Collection's online programs, including 'Cocktails With a Curator,' offer engaging introductions to the museum's holdings..

title: Takeout Over Cafes: Pandemic Shapes Consumption Habits
summary: Economists say consumer habits reflect continued social distancing amid fears the coronavirus pandemic won't be ending soon. U.S. consumers are buying again, but their shopping patterns show broad fears of persistent health risks amid the pandemic.

title: Oil Crash Crushes Individual Investors, Prompts Trading Overhaul
summary: After ordinary people racked up steep losses in an April collapse, the products that drew many into amateur commodities trading are getting revamped. For decades, regular people didn't trade commodities. But electronic trading and new investment products prompted amateur investors to start buying and selling oil.

title: Gasoline Is Cheap This July Fourth. Fuel Retailers Aren't Complaining.
summary: Historically large gasoline margins are helping convenience stores and others make up for lower fuel demand. Drivers hitting the road over July Fourth weekend are poised to enjoy the cheapest holiday gasoline prices in years, but the gas stations are doing OK, too.

title: U.S. Coronavirus Cases Hit New Single-Day High Ahead of July Fourth Weekend
summary: Daily Covid-19 cases top 52,000 in the U.S.; Washington state pauses phased reopening for two weeks. Coronavirus cases in the U.S. rose to another single-day high as the nation entered a Fourth of July weekend marked by restrictions on many activities and warnings to maintain social-distancing practices.

title: Clothing Retailer Lucky Brand Files for Bankruptcy
summary: Operator of Aéropostale and Nautica brands plans to purchase the jeans seller's business. Clothing retailer Lucky Brand Dungarees LLC has filed for bankruptcy with initial plans to close at least 13 stores and with a possible deal to sell its private equity-backed business to the operator of Aéropostale and Nautica brands.
